result.execSummary:
The defendant Damion M. Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $20.99 is to be paid in full no later than January 1, 2016.  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with the premises of the Copps Store located in Wautoma, WI.
Upon successful completion of probation term and full payment of all financial obligations, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damion M. Johnston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Damion M. Johnston
Current: 212 Fawn Lane, Oxford, WI 53952 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2015)
Prior: PO Box 306 133 E. High Street, Wautoma, WI 54982

Case Called @ 1:25 PM: Defendant Damion M. Johnston in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not want counsel and is prepared to resolve matter today.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - Rest request of $20.99. Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument as to penalty by DA.  Offers 2 separate resolutions.  Statement by Def: Yes.  The Court:  60 days WCJ (Huber and GT if revoked)  - I/S - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Rest of $20.99 to be PIF by 1/1/2016; No contact with Copps Store in Wautoma; upon successful completion of probation and full payment of costs, Def may petition for expungement; Court Costs plus Sample and DNA Surcharge - 60 DTP or PP; must complete ID process with WCSD.  Appeal Rights Given.  Procedure explained for expungement of DNA record through the DOJ.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $20.99
